title: Marjorie Taylor Greene Reports Private Security Warnings Amid Fallout With Trump | 10 News
description: The fallout is continuing after Donald Trump cut ties with Marjorie Taylor Greene, who was once one of his staunchest defenders.  The Republican congresswoman claims private security companies have contacted her with warnings for her safety. title: Pope Leo Hosts Actors & Directors At the Vatican To Celebrate Cinema | 10 News
description: Its not often celebrities are starstruck, but that's exactly what happened at The Vatican as Pope Leo rolled out the red carpet to celebrate cinema.   Australia’s very own Cate Blanchett was there, sharing a special gift with the Pontiff who issued a passionate plea about the future of film. title: Brother Of Man Behind Wheel Of NSW Derby Crash Speaks | 10 News+
description: Serious safety questions surrounding a freak accident at a demolition derby in north-west New South Wales that has left 13 people injured. Behind the wheel of the car was Steven Taylor an experienced demolition driver. 10 News+ spoke to Steven’s brother, Blake, who witnessed the whole incident. title: Rise Of Home Schooling, Pope Meets Cate Blanchett, Demi Moore & Billy Bob Talk Landman | 10 News+
description: A real-life Big Brother house is about to be called home by a group of young female influencers in South Australia. The "Tik Tok Party House" promises a summer of content creation, wild parties, and drinking games for its content creator occupants. The plan is going ahead despite the best efforts of former mayor, Simon McMahon, who spent years trying to change local laws and ban the party pad.  The COVID pandemic turned kitchen tables into classrooms across the country and since then, Australia has seen a staggering rise in families choosing to homeschool their children. One Aussie educator predicts up to half of all students could be home educated by 2050.  New Pope, Leo the 14th, has invited big-name celebrities, including Cate Blanchett and Chris Pine, to a special service in the Vatican. In light of cinemas across the world struggling to compete against streaming giants and the cost-of-living crisis, the pontiff has asked us all to go to the movies. New drilling oil drama, Landman, is returning for season 2. 10 News+ entertainment editor, Angela Bishop, sat down with its star, legends of the screen, Demi Moore and Billy Bob Thornton. title: Aussie Jack Della Maddalena Loses World Title After Dominant Win by Islam Makhachev | 10 News
description: Australia's Jack Della Maddalena has lost his welterweight world title - after falling to Russia's Islam Makhachev by unanimous decision.   Devastation for the 29-year-old who was dominated from the outset. title: Russia Captures Ukrainian Village, Pope Calls For End To War | 10 News
description: The Russian Defence Ministry says their nation's forces have claimed the villages of Rivnopillya and Mala Tokmachka in south-eastern Ukraine, as its offensive in the region progresses.  It comes with further heavy missile and drone attacks on the Ukrainian capital of Kyiv, with Pope Leo calling, and praying, for "stable peace" in the region.  The Pope, in an address said the Russian attacks "cause victims and injuries, including children, and extensive damage to civilian infrastructure, leaving families homeless as the cold advances". title: Dozens Of Flights Cancelled After Japan’s Sakurajima Volcano Erupts | 10 News
description: Locals are on alert and dozens of flights have been cancelled after a volcano on Japan's major western island of Kyushu erupted multiple times on Sunday.  Videos show a large plume of smoke and ash stretching from Sakurajima volcano, as high as 4.4 kilometres into the air over the city of Kagoshima.  The Japanese Meteorological Agency said it erupted around 1am, and there were two more eruptions at about 2:30 am and again at 8:50 am.  Local media reported it as the first eruption reaching 4 km or higher from the crater since October last year. title: Massive Fire Breaks Out At Decommissioned Texas Power Plant | 10 News
description: More than 50 firefighters from multiple departments have battled a massive inferno at a decommissioned power plant in Texas on Sunday.  Flames were seen billowing metres high as a huge black plume of smoke filled the sky over several cities in Galveston County, forcing local officials to issue a safety alert to nearby residents.  No injuries have been reported, and the cause of the fire is under investigation.
